task.title: Overriding an XSLT-processing step
task.shortdesc: You can override specific XSLT-processing steps in both the pre-processing pipeline and certain DITA-OT transformations.

step.cmd: Develop an XSL file that contains the XSL override.
Construct a plugin.xml file that contains the following content:
step.info:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <plugin id="plugin-id"> <feature extension="extension-point" file="relative-path"/> </plugin>where:
plugin-id is the plug-in identifier, for example, com.example.brandheader.
extension-point is the DITA-OT extension point, for example, dita.xsl.xhtml. This indicates the DITA-OT processing step that the XSL override applies to.
relative-path is the relative path and name of the XSLT file, for example, xsl/header.xsl.

taskbody.result: The plug-in installer adds an XSL import statement to the default DITA-OT code, so that the XSL override becomes part of the normal build.
